greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Replace 3^k with (-3)^k in ternary expansion of n.
comment: Base 3 representation for n (in lexicographic order) converted from base -3 to base 10.
Fixed point of the morphism 0-> 0,1,2 ; 1-> -3,-2,-1 ; 2-> -6,-5,-4 ; ...; n-> -3n,-3n+1,-3n+2. - _Philippe Deléham_, Oct 22 2011
link: Rémy Sigrist, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..19682

Dana G. Korssjoen, Biyao Li, Stefan Steinerberger, Raghavendra Tripathi, and Ruimin Zhang, Finding structure in sequences of real numbers via graph theory: a problem list, arXiv:2012.04625, Dec 08, 2020
formula: a(3*k+m) = -3*a(k)+m for 0 <= m < 3. - _Chai Wah Wu_, Jan 16 2020
mathematica: f[n_Integer, b_Integer] := Block[{l = IntegerDigits[n]}, Sum[l[[ -i]]*(-b)^(i - 1), {i, 1, Length[l]}]]; a = Table[ FromDigits[ IntegerDigits[n, 3]], {n, 0, 80}]; b = {}; Do[b = Append[b, f[a[[n]], 3]], {n, 1, 80}]; b
results.author: _Marc LeBrun_, Oct 31 2001
